ext2

Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.DataBlock
      • ext2.Directory

  • public class Directory
extends DataBlock
    Name: Directory This class represents a directory in a given volume. In this example in the ext2 filsystem, directories are treated as files, hence a reference to the file in this directory is stored. The user can choose to output the directory listing for a given file/directory.
    See Also:
    DataBlock

    • Constructor Detail

      • Directory

        public Directory(Ext2File file)
        Constructor to initialise a directory with a given file and initialise relevant instance variables.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getFileInfo

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFileInfo()
        Method to retrieve an array of strings - each string represents a directory/file in the listing. Each directory contains relevant information to that directory. The output is presented in a Unix-like format.
        Returns:
        An array of directory strings.

      • getDirRowAsString

        public java.lang.String getDirRowAsString(int offset)
        Method which returns a String containing a full, single line in a directory listing.
        Parameters:
        offset - The current offset in the directory listing (see getFileInfo())
        Returns:
        The directory 'row' as a string.

      • getINodeFromRow

        public INode getINodeFromRow(int offset)
        Method which returns the iNode of a file for a particular 'row' in the directory listing.
        Parameters:
        offset - The current offset of the 'row' in the listing (see getDirRowAsString())
        Returns:
        The iNode of the file in this 'row'.

      • getNextINode

        public INode getNextINode()
        Returns the iNode of the next file to search for when traversing the file system.
        Returns:
        The iNode instance for the next file to find.
